basic.floral_language:
Echeveria secunda var. glauca 
Floriography: delicate, beautiful, strong
Has a beautiful plant form, with fleshy oval leaves, slightly round tipped, leaf surface has a layer of white powders, leaves arranged in a rosette, like a blooming lotus, in a cool season with adequate sunlight, leaf tips turn red, very delicate and charming. 
Likes sunshine, shade properly under summer strong sunlight, does not have an apparent dormant period. Flowers sometimes, orange color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color pale green to blue green, with adequate sunlight, leaf tips turning to red

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, shade properly under summer strong light, no apparent period of dormancy
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, reduce water in summer high temperature
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
